title: What is the closest that 2 stars can be without them orbiting each other? - Quora

response.answer_text: What is the closest that 2 stars can be without them orbiting each other? That depends on the mass, trajectory and velocity of each star at the time in consideration. They might enter a perfect orbital distance but be traveling in such a way that instead of entering orbit, they just change direction. They could also be on a path where they collide, getting very close indeed.

What is the closest that 2 stars can be without them orbiting each other? Globular clusters… The key is to have other forces that make the force between the two a force that doesn’t dominate. And globular clusters are such places. Or go Sgr A*
